content: The president of Mexico and the Chamber of Deputies have a shared responsibility when it comes to implementing and enforcing laws. The Chamber of Deputies is responsible for proposing, discussing, and approving laws, while the president is responsible for signing them into law and ensuring they are enforced. The president also has the power to veto laws proposed by the Chamber of Deputies, although the chamber can override this veto with a two-thirds majority vote. Ultimately, both the president and the Chamber of Deputies work together to ensure that laws are implemented and enforced in Mexico.
